metadata.description: Factual claim verification using the strawberry profile of grounding-verification

credits.concept: Information-theoretic approach to hallucination detection using evidence scrubbing and bit-budget analysis
credits.adaptation: Cursor-native implementation using confidence delta comparison (logprobs not available)

frontmatter.name: strawberry-verification
frontmatter.description: Hallucination detection via two-pass verification. Uses grounding-verification base pattern with strawberry profile.

profileOverrides.description: Strawberry-specific overrides to base grounding-verification pattern
profileOverrides.note: This profile is the default/canonical implementation of the original Pythea concept

sections.title: Strawberry Verification Skill
sections.introduction: Strawberry Verification is the canonical profile of the grounding-verification pattern. It detects 'procedural hallucinations' where the AI generates correct information but then ignores it in the final output. Named after the classic 'how many r's in strawberry' problem.

concept.description: Detects 'procedural hallucinations' where the AI generates correct information but then ignores it in the final output
concept.example: Ask to count r's in 'strawberry'. AI writes 's-t-r-a-w-b-e-r-r-y', identifies each r, counts 3. Then outputs '2'.
concept.principle: If removing specific identifiers from evidence doesn't change confidence, the evidence wasn't actually used - indicating confabulation

whenToUse: After collecting evidence from grounding skills
For critical claims that could cause implementation failures
When multiple sources provide conflicting information
As the default profile when no domain-specific profile applies

process.name: Collect Evidence Spans
process.description: Gather all evidence with sources (see grounding-verification.json for full algorithm)

process.name: Extract Claims
process.description: Identify specific, falsifiable claims to verify

process.name: Scrubbed Evidence Test
process.description: Evaluate claim with anonymized evidence (identifiers replaced by placeholders)

process.name: Calculate Support Level
process.description: Compute confidence delta: delta = full_confidence - scrubbed_confidence

exampleVerification.claim: Table users has field email of type VARCHAR(255)

evidence.S0: From database docs: users.email stores user email addresses, VARCHAR(255)
evidence.S1: From schema catalog: email column, type VARCHAR, max length 255

scrubbedEvidence.S1: From catalog: [FIELD_1] column, type VARCHAR, max length [NUM_1]

scrubbedTest.reasoning: Cannot verify specific table/field without identifiers

fullTest.reasoning: Both sources confirm users.email is VARCHAR(255)

analysis.result: delta (0.65) >= threshold (0.3) â†’ Evidence is essential

confabulationIndicators: Claim seems obvious without needing the specific evidence
Scrubbed evidence supports claim just as well as full evidence
Confidence doesn't increase when adding specific identifiers
Claim uses generic patterns that would work for any similar object
importantRules: ALWAYS perform both scrubbed and full evidence tests
If scrubbed test passes too easily, be SUSPICIOUS - the claim may be confabulated
If UNSUPPORTED, do NOT proceed - gather more evidence or ask user
Document the reasoning for each verification decision
This is a self-check mechanism - be honest about uncertainty
